intro: Nothofagus × apiculata var. dubia, commonly known as the Australian blackbutt, is a hybrid evergreen tree native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Nothofagaceae family and is characterized by its dark, fissured bark and conical crown. The plant exhibits morphological variability, with var. dubia distinguished by its more elongated and pointed leaf tips. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soils. This variant plays a role in local ecosystems as both a habitat provider and a component of the native flora.
